intro: Micromeria imbricata var. villosa, commonly known as the hairy micromeria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance, while its flowers are small and usually white or pale yellow. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance.
